title: Trace: Invalid Conversion
story: Converting strings to numbers can fail if the string doesn't represent a valid number. ValueError traces help you catch these invalid conversions.
instructions: Study the traceback and identify why the conversion failed.

hints.text: ValueError happens when a function receives an argument of the right type but inappropriate value.
int() can only convert strings that represent valid integers.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 2, in <module>
    age = int(user_input)
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'twenty'

questions.question: What string value caused the error?
How can you prevent this error in production code?
questions.correctAnswer: Use try-except to catch ValueError, or validate input before converting
